msContents.summary: An agreement between three brothers to divide an inheritance received from their father

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; on the verso, a docket
11 lines; broken along vertical fold lines and at bottom
The hand is a compact, upright cursive

div.ab: In the consulship of our lords Constantine Augustus for the seventh time and Constantius the most noble Caesar for the first time, [month], [day]. Aurelii Horion and Eudaimon and Eulogios, three sons of Dionysios, son of Dioskorides, . . . our above mentioned father Dionysios departed his life, and we, his children, . . . we refrain from conflict with each other and division . . . [l. 5] it is agreed that we three make a division of our own shares for ourselves . . . and to Eudaimon 75 talents in silver for having a share . . . the arouras that exist in our father√¢¬Ä¬ôs name around the village of Senepta . . . to yield however much, or the two of us, Horion and Eudaimon, for a third . . . with a share being claimed by us, half a share, and however much there is of arouras . . .
